page.title: 10INTERVIEW - BUSINESS FAMILY
page.content: Sinclairs Bakery was started in 1883 by Mrs. Andrew's grandfather and has now been sold on her retirement. She has now moved to Sunny Banl Bogie Road, Rhynie. She has lived in Rhynie for all of her 62 years. She said her life was poorer than ours but she enjoyed it. She notices the changes in Rhynie, like the shops. There used to be many more shops including two butchers, a shoemakers and a barber. With the changes in the shops she has noticed changes in the leisure in Rhynie. There used to be a golf course, tennis court, and a putting green. The golf was situated at the Mains of Rhynie, the putting in the square and the tennis next to the football pitch. She would like to see more shops and more pleasures for the young and Rhynie.
